text: A famed and mysterious Beserker who shows during the Norse's darkest hour.
A famed and mysterious Beserker who shows during the Norse's darkest hour.
As long as this unit retains its presence, characters within this unit's ability radius will not die.
Characters within this unit's radius will take damage when this unit dies
As the battle starts, Raven will join the Ravenswyrd. As long as Raven is alive and is around the Ravenswyrd without flying, Ravenswyrd won't die
As long as this unit retains its presence, characters within this unit's ability radius will not die.
This character will leave faction and wander again if he gets wounded in battle

In the dire aftermath of the battlefield, when defeat's bitter taste lingers, a haunting caw pierces the desolation. As shadows dance with the fading light, the Ravenswyrd emerges from the ethereal mists, his silhouette a beacon of hope. A lone raven circles overhead, its ebony wings a shield against impending doom. With an otherworldly presence, the Ravenswyrd stands amidst the fallen, a living legend summoned by the gods to turn the tide of destiny. As he raises his weapon, a surge of primal energy courses through the beleaguered warriors, and a whisper on the wind foretells that even in the darkest hour, the Ravenswyrd shall stand guardian until the End of all things.
After the battle, the Ravenswyrd leaves your faction by turning into mist. Maybe one day, he will return if your faction falls into a dire situation again.
Blessed by the Ancient God entwined with the faiths of the old Nordic tribes, the Ravenswyrd unleases a destructive thunderstorm upon the battlefield.
The Ravenswyrd is blessed by Gods long lost to time, they're essence still lingering on as he wades through frontlines.
